greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of primes, inverse of A332211.
comment: Sequence is well-defined also in case there are only a finite number of Mersenne primes.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..86222
program: A332210list(up_to) = { my(lista=List([]), xs=Map(), i=1, q, u); for(n=1,up_to, if(!isprime(q=((2^n)-1)), while(mapisdefined(xs,prime(i)), i++); q = prime(i)); mapput(xs,q,n)); for(i=1,oo,if(!mapisdefined(xs,prime(i),&u),return(Vec(lista)),listput(lista,prime(u)))); };
\\ For computing a larger amount of terms, use the precomputed values of A000043:

A332210list(up_to) = { my(lista=List([]), xs=Map(), m000043 = Map(), i=1, q, u); for(k=1,#v000043,mapput(m000043,v000043[k],k)); for(n=1,min(up_to,v000043[#v000043]), if(mapisdefined(m000043,n), q = (2^n)-1, while(mapisdefined(xs,prime(i)), i++); q = prime(i)); mapput(xs,q,n)); for(i=1,oo,if(!mapisdefined(xs,prime(i),&u),return(Vec(lista)),listput(lista,prime(u)))); };
xref: Used to construct permutations A332213, A332215.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 09 2020
